reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I can actually brush my teeth
reviews.reviewText: I literally did not brush my teeth for half a year because of sensory problems. I know it's nasty, I'm so aware, it's a wonder I haven't had cavities or worse - yes I go to the dentist. Well I thought there's got to be something for autistic people like me. I found these. I still forget to brush, I'm trying to get into the habit, but I think "few times a week" is way better than "never" so it's a work in progress. Well I just want to say these are comfy and easy to use and don't make me disgusted, and since there's the 3 angles it hits from it gets the job done faster so less time suffering. I did think the bristles were a bit hard but other than that I really like the design of these!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The bristles are very stiff, and ridged. But they didn’t scrape my gums and my teeth felt clean.
reviews.reviewText: These are pretty nifty. My so. Has adhd and his ability to focus and do things efficiently is a struggle so this helps him get his teeth clean with out making it a long process.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good starter toothbrush for sensory/autistic kiddos. Some negatives though.
reviews.reviewText: Soooooo, I got this toothbrush for my kiddo. It's called the "Three Bristle Travel Toothbrush". It's got 3 small toothbrush heads angled in such a way that allows for all sides of the tooth to be brushed simultaneously, with "sensory safe material" all around. Intended to cut down teeth brushing time to just about 40 seconds. Rather than 2 minutes. (Not including floss time). It is the off brand one, and with that in mind there are some negative reviews for cheaper materials used...and it's not as good as the electric competitor. Start small work up to big, right? (They have a name brand electric one that looks INSANELY cool Lol )🤷‍♀️ ISSUES I HAVE WITH THIS PRODUCT:The major issues I have with this product are the materials used to line the toothbrush heads. I understand the concept, fully. The need for a sturdy toothbrush head is important, however the material isn't really "sensory safe"...it's harder plastic with little to no bend at all. When it scrapes against your gums it hurts, a lot! Even with minimal effort it still comes into contact with it. Advice for this would be to use a different material for the heads of the toothbrushes. A softer plastic or maybe a gel-like material. The bristles are hard, they definitely get the job done but I found they irritate even my teeth if brushed too hard or fast. They are soft enough that when my son bites down on the toothbrush, the bristles don't stab or poke into his gums though, that's really good. However, making them a bit smaller in size around and more of them together might alleviate this issue with the tips angled in such a way as to avoid any sensory triggers for some.Anywho, I think after day 2 we finally are starting to get the hang of it and now and my kiddo INSISTS on brushing his teeth himself. IN FRONT OF THE MIRROR! 😱🤯👏👏😂 The time spent on actual teeth brushing is actually longer than 40 seconds though because he likes it and is still getting the hang of it but for reals. Small miracles and tender mercies! I'll take the WIN! 🙌 Once he gets the hang of it we are definitely going to progress to the electric one! This was a good starter for sure!#yayforcleanteeth #autismlife #autismmom #alientoothbrush #threeheads #betterthanone

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Way too hard!
reviews.reviewText: I bought these for my little kids (7, 5 and 5) to help them with ensuring all sides of the teeth are brushed evenly. The bristles on these brushes are so hard and inflexible. They barely want to to go around the teeth and they will cause gum bleeding if you allow the kids to brush. I had to throw them away as they were not a good fit for my children.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works well, but the bristles seem to be plastic, and they don't last. My son has gone through three of them in a short period of time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Highly recommend . should be standard
reviews.reviewText: cleans better than any tooth brush I had before. the shape and the bristles work excellently together

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not sensory friendly
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my autistic teenaged son hoping it would make it easier for him to brush his teeth. The opening is not wide enough to fit over the teeth without biting down, and the bristles are hard plastic not regular toothbrush bristles. Even regular bristles hurt him, these are ridiculous! I guess they work for some people, based on reviews, but definitely not us.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gets the job done
reviews.reviewText: It's hard to get my son to brush his teeth he doesn't like the feel of it against his teeth. With this I'm able to get it done faster. So far so good no cavities so I guess it's getting the job done.

Los compré para mi hija con discapacidad, yo le cepillo los dientes, ella no sabe cómo hacerlo. Los recibí hace 3 semanas, solo duran 3 a 4 dias de uso. NO LOS RECOMIENDO. Se rompen, se despegan. Es peligroso que se despegue en uso, y se trague o peor, obstruya la garganta.

I have 2 kids with ADHD one of them possibly austic (waiting on diagnosis). I can partially the bristles are a bit stiffer than what most people are used to from regular brushes but they are gentle . The design allows the kids to get brushing over with quicker which is a plus. My oldest also compared it to a dental clean with how sqreaky clean their teeth felt .

Diese dreiseitigen Zahnbürsten sind einfach genial! Mein Kind hat Autismus, und das Zähneputzen war oft eine Herausforderung. Aber mit diesen Zahnbürsten hat sich alles zum Positiven gewendet.Die dreiseitige Form ermöglicht eine gründliche Reinigung von allen Seiten der Zähne – oben, unten und an den Seiten. Das ist besonders wichtig für Kinder mit Empfindlichkeiten oder sensorischen Herausforderungen. Die Borsten sind weich und schonend, was das Zähneputzen angenehmer macht.Die Größe der Zahnbürsten ist perfekt, nicht zu groß und nicht zu klein. Die Reiseversionen sind auch super praktisch für unterwegs. Mein Kind hat seine eigene Zahnbürste jetzt immer dabei, und das beruhigt uns beide.Die bunten Farben der Zahnbürsten machen sie zusätzlich attraktiv und kinderfreundlich. Die Qualität ist gut, und sie sind langlebig. Ich bin wirklich froh, dass ich diese Zahnbürsten entdeckt habe.Insgesamt gebe ich diesen dreiseitigen Zahnbürsten verdiente 5 Sterne. Sie sind eine echte Erleichterung für das tägliche Zähneputzen und haben das gesamte Erlebnis für mein Kind positiv verändert. Absolut empfehlenswert für Eltern, die nach einer Zahnbürste für besondere Bedürfnisse suchen!
Limpia pero las celdas son de plástico duro.
Usato da persone con disabilità, maneggevole pratico, non fa male e riescono a lavarsi i denti in tutte le direzioni con pochi movimenti, migliorando la loro autonomia
